title: BP hit by storms and lower oil prices
text:
Lower oil prices and tropical storms sent BP's profits plunging to a loss in the third quarter despite a better than expected performance in its trading division.

The firm sank $350m (£272m) into the red, down from a $3.1bn profit a year earlier.

However, BP's downstream business - which is responsible for refining and selling fossil fuels rather than drilling for them - performed better than expected, mainly due to the solid performance in trading.

This helped to offset weaker returns from the company's oil fields, which were hit by lower prices and storms in the Gulf of Mexico that disrupted supply.
